The proposal id is produced by hashing the ABI encoded `targets` array, the `values` array, the `calldatas` array and the descriptionHash (bytes32 which itself is the keccak256 hash of the description string). This proposal id can be produced from the proposal data which is part of the {ProposalCreated} event. It can even be computed in advance, before the proposal is submitted. Note that the chainId and the governor address are not part of the proposal id computation. Consequently, the same proposal (with same operation and same description) will have the same id if submitted on multiple governors across multiple networks. This also means that in order to execute the same operation twice (on the same governor) the proposer will have to change the description in order to avoid proposal id conflicts."},"name()":{"details":"See {IGovernor-name}."},"onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived}."},"onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received}."},"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}."},"proposalDeadline(uint256)":{"details":"See {IGovernor-proposalDeadline}."},"proposalEta(uint256)":{"details":"Public accessor to check the eta of a queued proposal"},"proposalProposer(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the account that created a given proposal."},"proposalSnapshot(uint256)":{"details":"See {IGovernor-proposalSnapshot}."},"proposalThreshold()":{"details":"Voting power need to be able to create a proposal"},"proposalVotes(uint256)":{"details":"Accessor to the internal vote counts."},"propose(address[],uint256[],bytes[],string)":{"details":"Submit a proposal on-chain","params":{"calldatas":"list of calldatas for the call","description":"description of the proposal","targets":"list of contracts to call","values":"list of values to pass in the call"}},"queue(address[],uint256[],bytes[],bytes32)":{"details":"Function to queue a proposal to the timelock."},"quorum(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the quorum."},"relay(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Relays a transaction or function call to an arbitrary target. CAUTION: It is not recommended to change the timelock while there are other queued governance proposals."},"version()":{"details":"See {IGovernor-version}."}},"title":"DivaGovernor Contract","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"addDelayConfiguration(bytes4[],bytes4[],bytes4[])":{"notice":"This function is used to add a delay configuration for function signatures"},"addThresholdConfiguration(bytes4[],bytes4[],bytes4[])":{"notice":"This function is used to add threshold configuration to functions"},"getSuccessThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the threshold type for a given function signature"},"updateDefaultDelay(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to update the default delay value"},"updateLongDelay(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to update the long delay value"},"updateShortDelay(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to update the short delay value"},"voteSucceeded(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns true if the proposal has succeeded"}},"notice":"DivaGovernor is an Open Zeppelin governor contract with customizations for the success thresholds and timelock controller aiming to securize the governance process while avoiding the need of roles and permissions. The main features are: - proposal threshold, anyone with a minimum amount of voting power can create a proposal. - voting delay, after the proposal is submitted on-chain, there is a waiting period where token holders can delegate their voting power. - voting period, after the voting delay, the proposal can be voted on-chain. - absolute quorum - a successful proposal is queued in the timelock controller. - a successful proposal can be executed after the timelock delay. A successful proposal can be enqueued by anyone. A successful proposal can be executed by anyone. 0.8.19;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/Governor.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/extensions/GovernorSettings.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/extensions/GovernorVotes.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport \"./GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable.sol\";\nimport \"./GovernorCountingThresholds.sol\";\nimport \"./DivaTimelockController.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev A cancellation proposal cannot have a value\n */\nerror CancellationProposalCannotHaveValue();\n\n/**\n * @dev Updating quorum to a value lower than the minimum quorum\n */\nerror QuorumTooLow(uint256 quorum, uint256 minQuorum);\n\n/**\n * @title DivaGovernor Contract\n * @author ShamirLabs\n * @notice DivaGovernor is an Open Zeppelin governor contract with customizations for the\n * success thresholds and timelock controller aiming to securize the governance process while\n * avoiding the need of roles and permissions.\n * The main features are:\n * - proposal threshold, anyone with a minimum amount of voting power can create a proposal.\n * - voting delay, after the proposal is submitted on-chain, there is a waiting period where token\n * holders can delegate their voting power.\n * - voting period, after the voting delay, the proposal can be voted on-chain.\n * - absolute quorum\n * - a successful proposal is queued in the timelock controller.\n * - a successful proposal can be executed after the timelock delay.\n *\n * A successful proposal can be enqueued by anyone.\n * A successful proposal can be executed by anyone.\n *\n * Any potentially malicious proposal can be cancelled by governance with another proposal with reduced\n * timelock waiting period.\n */\ncontract DivaGovernor is\n    Governor,\n    GovernorSettings,\n    GovernorVotes,\n    GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable,\n    GovernorCountingThresholds\n{\n    uint256 public constant MIN_QUORUM = 5_000_000_000_000_000_000_000_000; // 5 M DIVA tokens is the minimum quorum.\n\n    struct GovernanceParameters {\n        string governorName;\n        uint16 votingDelay;\n        uint32 votingPeriod;\n        uint256 quorumAbsolute;\n        uint256 proposalThreshold;\n        uint256 defaultDelay;\n        uint256 shortDelay;\n        uint256 longDelay;\n        bytes4[] functionSignatures;\n        DelayType[] functionDelays;\n        ThresholdType[] functionThresholds;\n    }\n\n    uint256 private _quorum;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when the quorum is updated.\n     */\n    event QuorumUpdated(uint256 oldQuorum, uint256 newQuorum);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev DivaGovernor Constructor\n     * @param _token ERC20 token with ERC20Votes extension\n     * @param _timelock DivaTimelockControlller instance\n     * @param _settings governor settings\n     */\n    constructor(\n        IVotes _token,\n        DivaTimelockController _timelock,\n        GovernanceParameters memory _settings\n    )\n        Governor(_settings.governorName)\n        GovernorSettings(\n            _settings.votingDelay,\n            _settings.votingPeriod,\n            _settings.proposalThreshold\n        )\n        GovernorVotes(_token)\n        GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable(\n            _timelock,\n            _settings.functionSignatures,\n            _settings.functionDelays,\n            _settings.defaultDelay,\n            _settings.shortDelay,\n            _settings.longDelay\n        )\n        GovernorCountingThresholds(\n            _settings.functionSignatures,\n            _settings.functionThresholds\n        )\n    {\n        _quorum = _settings.quorumAbsolute;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Changes the quorum.\n     *\n     * Emits a {QuorumUpdated} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - Must be called through a governance proposal.\n     */\n    function updateQuorum(uint256 newQuorum) external onlyGovernance {\n        if (newQuorum < MIN_QUORUM) revert QuorumTooLow(newQuorum, MIN_QUORUM);\n        uint256 oldQuorum = _quorum;\n        _quorum = newQuorum;\n        emit QuorumUpdated(oldQuorum, newQuorum);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the quorum.\n     */\n    function quorum(uint256) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return _quorum;\n    }\n\n    // The following functions are overrides required by Solidity.\n\n    function votingDelay()\n        public\n        view\n        override(IGovernor, GovernorSettings)\n        returns (uint256)\n    {\n        return super.votingDelay();\n    }\n\n    function votingPeriod()\n        public\n        view\n        override(IGovernor, GovernorSettings)\n        returns (uint256)\n    {\n        return super.votingPeriod();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the state of a proposal\n     * @param proposalId id of the proposal\n     */\n    function state(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        override(Governor, GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable)\n        returns (ProposalState)\n    {\n        return super.state(proposalId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit a proposal on-chain\n     * @param targets list of contracts to call\n     * @param values list of values to pass in the call\n     * @param calldatas list of calldatas for the call\n     * @param description description of the proposal\n     */\n    function propose(\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        string memory description\n    ) public override(Governor, IGovernor) returns (uint256) {\n        // @dev a cancellation proposal cannot have value.\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < calldatas.length; i++) {\n            bytes4 sig = bytes4(calldatas[i]);\n            if (sig == CANCEL_PROPOSAL_TYPEHASH && values[i] > 0)\n                revert CancellationProposalCannotHaveValue();\n        }\n\n        _setSuccessThreshold(targets, values, calldatas, description);\n        return super.propose(targets, values, calldatas, description);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Voting power need to be able to create a proposal\n     */\n    function proposalThreshold()\n        public\n        view\n        override(Governor, GovernorSettings)\n        returns (uint256)\n    {\n        return super.proposalThreshold();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Execute a successful proposal\n     * @param proposalId id of the proposal\n     */\n    function _execute(\n        uint256 proposalId,\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        bytes32 descriptionHash\n    ) internal override(Governor, GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable) {\n        super._execute(proposalId, targets, values, calldatas, descriptionHash);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cancel a proposal from governor. (Not publicly available in diva governor)\n     */\n    function _cancel(\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        bytes32 descriptionHash\n    ) internal override(Governor) returns (uint256) {\n        return super._cancel(targets, values, calldatas, descriptionHash);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get the address of the executor\n     */\n    function _executor()\n        internal\n        view\n        override(Governor, GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable)\n        returns (address)\n    {\n        return super._executor();\n    }\n\n    function supportsInterface(\n        bytes4 interfaceId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        override(Governor, GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable)\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xc89114a3b0daae7f7ff8c5d9cf59b2e83541cd17c8d5171ce0ed745667fc9073","license":"MIT"},"contracts/DivaTimelockController.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.19;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/TimelockController.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Error: fail to initialise timelock controller either attempting to initialise twice or\n * attempting to initialise with an invalid governor address.\n */\nerror FailToInitialiseTimelockController(bool initialised, address governor);\n\n/**\n * @title DivaTimelockController Contract\n * @author ShamirLabs\n * @notice This contract is used to queue successful proposals.\n */\ncontract DivaTimelockController is TimelockController {\n    bool private _initialised;\n\n    constructor(\n        uint256 minDelay\n    )\n        TimelockController(\n            minDelay,\n            new address[](0),\n            new address[](0),\n            msg.sender\n        )\n    {}\n\n    // @dev This function has to be called after the contract is deployed to setup the\n    // governance contract correctly.\n    function initialiseAndRevokeAdminRole(\n        address _governor\n    ) external onlyRole(TIMELOCK_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        if (_initialised == false && _governor != address(0)) {\n            _setupRole(EXECUTOR_ROLE, address(0)); // @dev grant EXECUTOR_ROLE to everyone\n            _setupRole(PROPOSER_ROLE, _governor);\n            _setupRole(CANCELLER_ROLE, address(this));\n\n            _revokeRole(TIMELOCK_ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender());\n\n            _initialised = true;\n        } else {\n            revert FailToInitialiseTimelockController(_initialised, _governor);\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x49d92f99be658270b2d4dfefc6368c19048e2519b958d094151c03aa89e615a7","license":"MIT"},"contracts/GovernorCountingThresholds.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.19;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/Governor.sol\";\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for invalid configuration of thresholds\n */\nerror DaoInvalidThresholdTypeConfiguration();\n\n/**\n * @title GovernorCountingThresholds extension\n * @author ShamirLabs\n * @dev Extension of {Governor} for simple, 3 options, vote counting. Three different thresholds\n * for a proposal to be successful can be configured:\n * - DEFAULT: 50% + 1\n * - MODERATE: 66% + 1\n * - LARGE: 75% + 1\n */\nabstract contract GovernorCountingThresholds is Governor {\n    /**\n     * @dev Supported vote types. Matches Governor Bravo ordering.\n     */\n    enum VoteType {\n        Against,\n        For,\n        Abstain\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev three thresholds types\n     */\n    enum ThresholdType {\n        DEFAULT,\n        MODERATE,\n        LARGE\n    }\n\n    struct ProposalVote {\n        uint256 againstVotes;\n        uint256 forVotes;\n        uint256 abstainVotes;\n        mapping(address => bool) hasVoted;\n        ThresholdType successThreshold; // @dev store proposal threshold at proposition time\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev emitted when a proposal success threshold is set\n     */\n    event SuccessThresholdTypeSet(uint256 proposalId, ThresholdType threshold);\n\n    mapping(uint256 => ProposalVote) private _proposalVotes;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev threshold thresholds per target per function\n     */\n    mapping(bytes4 => ThresholdType) private _targetFunctionThreshold;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice GovernorCountingThresholds Constructor\n     * @param functionSignatures list of function signatures\n     * @param functionsThresholds list of ThresholdType\n     */\n    constructor(\n        bytes4[] memory functionSignatures,\n        ThresholdType[] memory functionsThresholds\n    ) {\n        if (functionSignatures.length != functionsThresholds.length)\n            revert DaoInvalidThresholdTypeConfiguration();\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < functionSignatures.length; i++) {\n            _targetFunctionThreshold[\n                functionSignatures[i]\n            ] = functionsThresholds[i];\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used to add threshold configuration to functions\n     * @param signaturesLargeThreshold list of function signatures that should have a large threshold\n     * @param signaturesModerateThreshold list of function signatures that should have a moderate threshold\n     * @param signaturesDefaultThreshold list of function signatures that should have a default threshold\n     */\n    function addThresholdConfiguration(\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesLargeThreshold,\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesModerateThreshold,\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesDefaultThreshold\n    ) external onlyGovernance {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesLargeThreshold.length; i++) {\n            _targetFunctionThreshold[\n                signaturesLargeThreshold[i]\n            ] = ThresholdType.LARGE;\n        }\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesModerateThreshold.length; i++) {\n            _targetFunctionThreshold[\n                signaturesModerateThreshold[i]\n            ] = ThresholdType.MODERATE;\n        }\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesDefaultThreshold.length; i++) {\n            _targetFunctionThreshold[\n                signaturesDefaultThreshold[i]\n            ] = ThresholdType.DEFAULT;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IGovernor-COUNTING_MODE}.\n     */\n    // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase\n    function COUNTING_MODE()\n        public\n        pure\n        virtual\n        override\n        returns (string memory)\n    {\n        return \"support=bravo&quorum=for,abstain\";\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IGovernor-hasVoted}.\n     */\n    function hasVoted(\n        uint256 proposalId,\n        address account\n    ) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return _proposalVotes[proposalId].hasVoted[account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Accessor to the internal vote counts.\n     */\n    function proposalVotes(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        virtual\n        returns (uint256 againstVotes, uint256 forVotes, uint256 abstainVotes)\n    {\n        ProposalVote storage proposalVote = _proposalVotes[proposalId];\n        return (\n            proposalVote.againstVotes,\n            proposalVote.forVotes,\n            proposalVote.abstainVotes\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {Governor-_quorumReached}.\n     */\n    function _quorumReached(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) internal view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        ProposalVote storage proposalVote = _proposalVotes[proposalId];\n\n        return\n            quorum(proposalSnapshot(proposalId)) <=\n            proposalVote.forVotes + proposalVote.abstainVotes;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the threshold type for a given function signature\n     * @param proposalId function signature\n     */\n    function getSuccessThreshold(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) public view virtual returns (ThresholdType) {\n        return _proposalVotes[proposalId].successThreshold;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {Governor-_voteSucceeded}. In this module, the forVotes must be strictly over the againstVotes.\n     * @param proposalId id of the proposal\n     */\n    function _voteSucceeded(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) internal view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        bool result;\n        ProposalVote storage proposalVote = _proposalVotes[proposalId];\n        ThresholdType threshold = _proposalVotes[proposalId].successThreshold;\n\n        // @dev edge cases for againsVotes and forVotes\n        if (threshold == ThresholdType.LARGE) {\n            // @dev LARGE threshold is a super majority of 75% |||   FOR / (FOR + AGAINST)) > 3/4 ->  4 * FOR > 3 * (FOR + AGAINST) ->  FOR > 3 * TOTAL\n            result = (proposalVote.forVotes > 3 * proposalVote.againstVotes);\n        } else if (threshold == ThresholdType.MODERATE) {\n            // @dev MODERATE threshold is a super majority of 66% FOR / (FOR + AGAINST)) > 2/3 ->  3 * FOR > 2 * (FOR + AGAINST) ->  FOR > 2 * AGAINST\n            result = (proposalVote.forVotes > 2 * proposalVote.againstVotes);\n        } else {\n            // @dev DEFAULT threshold is a super majority of 50% FOR / (FOR + AGAINST)) > 1/2 -> 2 * FOR > 1 * (FOR + AGAINST)\n            result = (proposalVote.forVotes > proposalVote.againstVotes);\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns true if the proposal has succeeded\n     */\n    function voteSucceeded(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return _voteSucceeded(proposalId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used at the proposal creation time to set the success threshold based on the function\n     * signatures of the actions\n     */\n    function _setSuccessThreshold(\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        string memory description\n    ) internal {\n        uint256 proposalId = hashProposal(\n            targets,\n            values,\n            calldatas,\n            keccak256(bytes(description))\n        );\n\n        // @dev start with default threshold\n        ThresholdType threshold = ThresholdType.DEFAULT;\n\n        // @dev increase it if any of the targets has a function with a higher threshold\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < calldatas.length; i++) {\n            bytes4 sig = bytes4(calldatas[i]);\n\n            if (_targetFunctionThreshold[sig] == ThresholdType.LARGE) {\n                threshold = ThresholdType.LARGE;\n                break;\n            }\n\n            if (_targetFunctionThreshold[sig] == ThresholdType.MODERATE) {\n                threshold = ThresholdType.MODERATE;\n            }\n        }\n\n        _proposalVotes[proposalId].successThreshold = threshold;\n        emit SuccessThresholdTypeSet(proposalId, threshold);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {Governor-_countVote}. In this module, the support follows the `VoteType` enum (from Governor Bravo).\n     */\n    function _countVote(\n        uint256 proposalId,\n        address account,\n        uint8 support,\n        uint256 weight,\n        bytes memory // params\n    ) internal virtual override {\n        ProposalVote storage proposalVote = _proposalVotes[proposalId];\n\n        require(\n            !proposalVote.hasVoted[account],\n            \"GovernorVotingSimple: vote already cast\"\n        );\n        proposalVote.hasVoted[account] = true;\n\n        if (support == uint8(VoteType.Against)) {\n            proposalVote.againstVotes += weight;\n        } else if (support == uint8(VoteType.For)) {\n            proposalVote.forVotes += weight;\n        } else if (support == uint8(VoteType.Abstain)) {\n            proposalVote.abstainVotes += weight;\n        } else {\n            revert(\"GovernorVotingSimple: invalid value for enum VoteType\");\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x0bf2bc2750b0a9b5df47b7bb45bed87193c9c3a6885922793e66b9a62d30208b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.19;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/extensions/IGovernorTimelock.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/Governor.sol\";\nimport \"./DivaTimelockController.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for invalid configuration of delays\n */\nerror DaoInvalidDelaysConfiguration();\n\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for invalid configuration of delays\n */\nerror DaoInvalidDelaysSetup();\n\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for invalid configuration of delays\n */\nerror CancelProposalMustHaveShortDelay();\n\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for invalid configuration of delays\n */\nerror InvalidDelayValue();\n\n/**\n * @dev Custom error for short delay proposal with value\n */\nerror ShortDelayProposalCannotHaveValue();\n\n/**\n * @title GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable extension\n * @author ShamirLabs\n * @dev Extension of {Governor} that binds the execution process to an instance of {TimelockController}. This adds a custom\n * delay based on function signature in actions, enforced by the {TimelockController} to all successful proposal (in addition to the voting duration). The\n * {Governor} needs the proposer (and ideally the executor) roles for the {Governor} to work properly.\n */\nabstract contract GovernorTimelockControlConfigurable is\n    IGovernorTimelock,\n    Governor\n{\n    DivaTimelockController private _timelock;\n    mapping(uint256 => bytes32) private _timelockIds;\n    mapping(bytes4 => DelayType) private _functionsDelays;\n    uint256 private _defaultDelay;\n    uint256 private _shortDelay;\n    uint256 private _longDelay;\n\n    uint256 private constant SECONDS_PER_BLOCK = 12;\n\n    bytes4 public constant CANCEL_PROPOSAL_TYPEHASH =\n        bytes4(keccak256(bytes(\"cancel(bytes32)\")));\n\n    enum DelayType {\n        // we do not need it here but we keep it at the first slot so when\n        // _functionsDelays is queried, if an entry does not exist in the mapping (and returns 0)\n        // will be the same than setting it to DEFAULT\n        DEFAULT,\n        // short delay type is used for emergency proposals\n        // in order for a proposal to have a SHORT delay, all functions calls must have the SHORT delay type\n        // This is to avoid having a malicious proposal bypass the timelock by including just a pause function after\n        // the malicious operation\n        SHORT,\n        // long delay type is used to operations like recovering funds from the pool\n        // as long as 1 function call belongs to this type, the whole proposal will have a LONG delay\n        // This is to avoid a malicious DAO to include any actions PLUS recovering funds from the pool\n        // and bypass the long timelock to give users time to recover their positions\n        LONG\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when the timelock controller used for proposal execution is modified.\n     */\n    event TimelockChange(address oldTimelock, address newTimelock);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Set the timelock and configure timelocks for function signatures\n     *\n     */\n    constructor(\n        DivaTimelockController timelockAddress,\n        bytes4[] memory functionSignatures,\n        DelayType[] memory functionsDelays,\n        uint256 defaultDelay,\n        uint256 shortDelay,\n        uint256 longDelay\n    ) {\n        // @dev enforce proper configuration in deployment\n        if (shortDelay >= defaultDelay || longDelay <= defaultDelay) {\n            revert DaoInvalidDelaysSetup();\n        }\n\n        _defaultDelay = defaultDelay;\n        _shortDelay = shortDelay;\n        _longDelay = longDelay;\n\n        if (functionSignatures.length != functionsDelays.length) {\n            revert DaoInvalidDelaysConfiguration();\n        }\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < functionSignatures.length; i++) {\n            _functionsDelays[functionSignatures[i]] = functionsDelays[i];\n        }\n\n        _updateTimelock(timelockAddress);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used to add a delay configuration for function signatures\n     * @param signaturesLongDelay function signatures to be set with a long delay\n     * @param signaturesShortDelay function signatures to be set with a short delay\n     * @param signaturesDefaultDelay function signatures to be set with a default delay\n     */\n    function addDelayConfiguration(\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesLongDelay,\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesShortDelay,\n        bytes4[] memory signaturesDefaultDelay\n    ) external onlyGovernance {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesLongDelay.length; i++) {\n            if (signaturesLongDelay[i] == CANCEL_PROPOSAL_TYPEHASH)\n                revert CancelProposalMustHaveShortDelay();\n\n            _functionsDelays[signaturesLongDelay[i]] = DelayType.LONG;\n        }\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesShortDelay.length; i++) {\n            _functionsDelays[signaturesShortDelay[i]] = DelayType.SHORT;\n        }\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < signaturesDefaultDelay.length; i++) {\n            if (signaturesDefaultDelay[i] == CANCEL_PROPOSAL_TYPEHASH)\n                revert CancelProposalMustHaveShortDelay();\n            _functionsDelays[signaturesDefaultDelay[i]] = DelayType.DEFAULT;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used to update the short delay value\n     * @param newDelay new delay to be set\n     */\n    function updateShortDelay(uint256 newDelay) external onlyGovernance {\n        if (newDelay >= _defaultDelay) revert InvalidDelayValue();\n\n        _shortDelay = newDelay;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used to update the default delay value\n     * @param newDelay new delay to be set\n     */\n    function updateDefaultDelay(uint256 newDelay) external onlyGovernance {\n        if (_shortDelay >= newDelay || newDelay >= _longDelay)\n            revert InvalidDelayValue();\n\n        _defaultDelay = newDelay;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This function is used to update the long delay value\n     * @param newDelay new delay to be set\n     */\n    function updateLongDelay(uint256 newDelay) external onlyGovernance {\n        if (newDelay <= _defaultDelay) revert InvalidDelayValue();\n\n        _longDelay = newDelay;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(\n        bytes4 interfaceId\n    ) public view virtual override(IERC165, Governor) returns (bool) {\n        return\n            interfaceId == type(IGovernorTimelock).interfaceId ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Overridden version of the {Governor-state} function with added support for the `Queued` status.\n     */\n    function state(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        virtual\n        override(IGovernor, Governor)\n        returns (ProposalState)\n    {\n        ProposalState status = super.state(proposalId);\n        if (status != ProposalState.Succeeded) {\n            return status;\n        }\n\n        // core tracks execution, so we just have to check if successful proposal have been queued.\n        bytes32 queueid = _timelockIds[proposalId];\n        if (queueid == bytes32(0)) {\n            return status;\n        } else if (_timelock.isOperationDone(queueid)) {\n            return ProposalState.Executed;\n        } else if (_timelock.isOperationPending(queueid)) {\n            return ProposalState.Queued;\n        } else {\n            return ProposalState.Canceled;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Public accessor to check the address of the timelock\n     */\n    function timelock() public view virtual override returns (address) {\n        return address(_timelock);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Public accessor to check the eta of a queued proposal\n     */\n    function proposalEta(\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) public view virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 eta = _timelock.getTimestamp(_timelockIds[proposalId]);\n        return eta == 1 ? 0 : eta; // _DONE_TIMESTAMP (1) should be replaced with a 0 value\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Function to queue a proposal to the timelock.\n     */\n    function queue(\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        bytes32 descriptionHash\n    ) public virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 proposalId = hashProposal(\n            targets,\n            values,\n            calldatas,\n            descriptionHash\n        );\n        require(\n            state(proposalId) == ProposalState.Succeeded,\n            \"Governor: proposal not successful\"\n        );\n\n        uint256 delay = _getDelay(calldatas, values);\n        _timelockIds[proposalId] = _timelock.hashOperationBatch(\n            targets,\n            values,\n            calldatas,\n            0,\n            descriptionHash\n        );\n\n        _timelock.scheduleBatch(\n            targets,\n            values,\n            calldatas,\n            0,\n            descriptionHash,\n            delay\n        );\n\n        emit ProposalQueued(proposalId, block.timestamp + delay);\n        return proposalId;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Public endpoint to update the underlying timelock instance. Restricted to the timelock itself, so updates\n     * must be proposed, scheduled, and executed through governance proposals.\n     *\n     * CAUTION: It is not recommended to change the timelock while there are other queued governance proposals.\n     */\n    function updateTimelock(\n        DivaTimelockController newTimelock\n    ) external virtual onlyGovernance {\n        _updateTimelock(newTimelock);\n    }\n\n    function _updateTimelock(DivaTimelockController newTimelock) private {\n        emit TimelockChange(address(_timelock), address(newTimelock));\n        _timelock = newTimelock;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Function used to calculate the timelock delay based on the actions the proposal is trying to eventually execute\n     * If there is ONE function with DelayType == LONG delay, we return _longDelay\n     * If ALL functions have DelayType == SHORT, we return _shortDelay\n     * Otherwise, we return _defaultDelay\n     */\n    function _getDelay(\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        uint256[] memory values\n    ) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        // if there are no functions to execute in a proposal, it won't use the SHORT delay\n        // it will also NOT enter the loop, which means the DEFAULT delay will be used\n        bool isShortDelay = calldatas.length > 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < calldatas.length; i++) {\n            bytes4 sig = bytes4(calldatas[i]);\n\n            // @dev any proposal that attempts to withdraw ETH uses long delay\n            if (values[i] > 0) {\n                return _longDelay * SECONDS_PER_BLOCK;\n            }\n\n            DelayType delay = _functionsDelays[sig];\n            if (delay == DelayType.LONG) {\n                return _longDelay * SECONDS_PER_BLOCK;\n            }\n            if (delay != DelayType.SHORT) {\n                isShortDelay = false;\n            }\n        }\n        return\n            isShortDelay == true\n                ? _shortDelay * SECONDS_PER_BLOCK\n                : _defaultDelay * SECONDS_PER_BLOCK;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Overridden execute function that run the already queued proposal through the timelock.\n     */\n    function _execute(\n        uint256 /* proposalId */,\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory calldatas,\n        bytes32 descriptionHash\n    ) internal virtual override {\n        _timelock.executeBatch{value: msg.value}(\n            targets,\n            values,\n            calldatas,\n            0,\n            descriptionHash\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Address through which the governor executes action. In this case, the timelock.\n     */\n    function _executor() internal view virtual override returns (address) {\n        return address(_timelock);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x93dfcee039847834eaccbaed72d0ea5d7203afda0f32fb522d523ee2a39927cb","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

VoteCastWithParams(address,uint256,uint8.details: Emitted when a vote is cast with params. Note: `support` values should be seen as buckets. Their interpretation depends on the voting module used. `params` are additional encoded parameters. Their interpepretation also depends on the voting module used.

CLOCK_MODE().details: Machine-readable description of the clock as specified in EIP-6372.

params.signaturesDefaultDelay: function signatures to be set with a default delay
params.signaturesLongDelay: function signatures to be set with a long delay
params.signaturesShortDelay: function signatures to be set with a short delay

params.signaturesDefaultThreshold: list of function signatures that should have a default threshold
params.signaturesLargeThreshold: list of function signatures that should have a large threshold
params.signaturesModerateThreshold: list of function signatures that should have a moderate threshold

clock().details: Clock (as specified in EIP-6372) is set to match the token's clock. Fallback to block numbers if the token does not implement EIP-6372.

hashProposal(address[],uint256[],bytes[].details: See {IGovernor-hashProposal}. The proposal id is produced by hashing the ABI encoded `targets` array, the `values` array, the `calldatas` array and the descriptionHash (bytes32 which itself is the keccak256 hash of the description string). This proposal id can be produced from the proposal data which is part of the {ProposalCreated} event. It can even be computed in advance, before the proposal is submitted. Note that the chainId and the governor address are not part of the proposal id computation. Consequently, the same proposal (with same operation and same description) will have the same id if submitted on multiple governors across multiple networks. This also means that in order to execute the same operation twice (on the same governor) the proposer will have to change the description in order to avoid proposal id conflicts.

proposalEta(uint256).details: Public accessor to check the eta of a queued proposal

proposalProposer(uint256).details: Returns the account that created a given proposal.

proposalThreshold().details: Voting power need to be able to create a proposal

proposalVotes(uint256).details: Accessor to the internal vote counts.

params.calldatas: list of calldatas for the call
params.values: list of values to pass in the call

queue(address[],uint256[],bytes[],bytes3.details: Function to queue a proposal to the timelock.

relay(address,uint256,bytes).details: Relays a transaction or function call to an arbitrary target. In cases where the governance executor is some contract other than the governor itself, like when using a timelock, this function can be invoked in a governance proposal to recover tokens or Ether that was sent to the governor contract by mistake. Note that if the executor is simply the governor itself, use of `relay` is redundant.

setProposalThreshold(uint256).details: Update the proposal threshold. This operation can only be performed through a governance proposal. Emits a {ProposalThresholdSet} event.

setVotingDelay(uint256).details: Update the voting delay. This operation can only be performed through a governance proposal. Emits a {VotingDelaySet} event.

setVotingPeriod(uint256).details: Update the voting period. This operation can only be performed through a governance proposal. Emits a {VotingPeriodSet} event.

state(uint256).details: Get the state of a proposal

timelock().details: Public accessor to check the address of the timelock

updateQuorum(uint256).details: Changes the quorum. Emits a {QuorumUpdated} event. Requirements: - Must be called through a governance proposal.

updateTimelock(address).details: Public endpoint to update the underlying timelock instance. Restricted to the timelock itself, so updates must be proposed, scheduled, and executed through governance proposals. CAUTION: It is not recommended to change the timelock while there are other queued governance proposals.

addDelayConfiguration(bytes4[],bytes4[],.notice: This function is used to add a delay configuration for function signatures

addThresholdConfiguration(bytes4[],bytes.notice: This function is used to add threshold configuration to functions

getSuccessThreshold(uint256).notice: Returns the threshold type for a given function signature

updateDefaultDelay(uint256).notice: This function is used to update the default delay value

updateLongDelay(uint256).notice: This function is used to update the long delay value

updateShortDelay(uint256).notice: This function is used to update the short delay value

voteSucceeded(uint256).notice: Returns true if the proposal has succeeded

userdoc.notice: DivaGovernor is an Open Zeppelin governor contract with customizations for the success thresholds and timelock controller aiming to securize the governance process while avoiding the need of roles and permissions. The main features are: - proposal threshold, anyone with a minimum amount of voting power can create a proposal. - voting delay, after the proposal is submitted on-chain, there is a waiting period where token holders can delegate their voting power. - voting period, after the voting delay, the proposal can be voted on-chain. - absolute quorum - a successful proposal is queued in the timelock controller. - a successful proposal can be executed after the timelock delay. A successful proposal can be enqueued by anyone. A successful proposal can be executed by anyone. Any potentially malicious proposal can be cancelled by governance with another proposal with reduced timelock waiting period.
